subject: Fashion
title: Indigo and the Slave Trade
description: A micro-lesson that makes Indigo and the Slave Trade usable.

hook.text: Your blue jeans carry the legacy of enslaved people forced to farm indigo.

buildup.text: Indigo plantations in the Americas relied on brutal slave labor for centuries.

discovery.text: Processing indigo was toxicâ€”enslaved workers suffered chemical burns and illness.

twist.text: Indigo was so valuable it was called 'blue gold' and traded like currency.

climax.text: Denim's popularity means indigo's dark history is worn daily, largely unknown.

punchline.text: Every pair of jeans carries a history most wearers never learn.
